result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Anastacio P Villegas in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Adam Stuart and Assistant District Attorney Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #15CF1445.
Hearing on July 18, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anastacio P Villegas in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek was retained yesterday, 4/6/17.  Attorney Kershek requests an adjournment for plea and sentence in 60 days as he needs to review things with Defendant.   Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anastacio P Villegas in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Kershek appears as friend of the court.  Attorney Kershek requests an adjournment.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on April 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
letter from Attorney Kershek dated 2/23/17 stating that Defendant is trying to retain him.

Defendant Anastacio P Villegas in court.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states that he is in the process of retaining Attorney Mark Kershek and provides letter from Attorney Kershek stating such.  Defendant requests an adjournment so that the can retain Attorney Kershek and appear with him at next court date.  Court denies request.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on March 16, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Anastacio P Villegas in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests an adjournment, stating he is still trying to retain counsel.  State makes statements.  Court reschedules Defendant's other case for jury status and jury trial.  This case to go in on jury status date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 16, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on December 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Anastacio P Villegas in court.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he is still trying to obtain counsel.  Court adjourns.  Hearing scheduled for December 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Anastacio P Villegas in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he is still trying to save money to obtain counsel.  Court adjourns so Defendant can obtain counsel.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on August 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anastacio P Villegas in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is requesting the court to appoint counsel. Court denied the request. Court gives him additional time to hire counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on July 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Anastacio P Villegas in court with Attorney Amy C Scholz.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion to withdraw as counsel.  Attorney Scholz requests to withdraw as counsel for reasons stated on the record.  Court grants request.  Defendant states he will be seeking new counsel.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with witness listed in the criminal complaint or her property.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
